Interface_name: UDP based on Boost.Asio in C++
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a UDP-based client-server communication system using Boost.Asio in C++ that demonstrates asynchronous sending and receiving of datagrams.

Class Description: The `udp_communicator` class provides asynchronous UDP communication capabilities for both sending and receiving datagrams. It manages socket operations, IO context, and buffers for network communication.

Attributes:
- io_context_: boost::asio::io_context - Manages asynchronous operations for Boost.Asio
- socket_: boost::asio::ip::udp::socket - Represents the UDP socket for communication
- receiver_endpoint_: boost::asio::ip::udp::endpoint - Stores the endpoint information for receiving data
- sender_endpoint_: boost::asio::ip::udp::endpoint - Stores the endpoint information of the sender
- receive_buffer_: std::array<char, 1024> - Buffer for storing received data
- send_buffer_: std::string - Buffer for storing data to be sent

Methods:
- constructor(io_context, port) -> void - Initializes the UDP socket and binds it to the specified port
- start_receive() -> void - Begins asynchronous reception of UDP datagrams
- handle_receive(error_code, bytes_transferred) -> void - Callback for handling received data
- send_to(message, endpoint) -> void - Asynchronously sends a message to the specified endpoint
- handle_send(error_code, bytes_transferred) -> void - Callback for handling send completion
- get_socket() -> boost::asio::ip::udp::socket& - Returns a reference to the UDP socket
- get_io_context() -> boost::asio::io_context& - Returns a reference to the IO context
